overview: Rhonda Smith co-founded Words and Pictures in 1987 with partner Wesley Shaw after garnering several years experience writing and producing television commercials and ads for McCormack & Co., a New York City advertising agency. Smithâ€™s unique educational background includes a B.F.A. in Theater Arts, Broadcasting and English from the University of Mississippi, and extensive post-graduate work in advertising and copywriting at the School of Visual Arts and the New School in NYC. Smith has garnered numerous regional and national awards for copywriting excellence and creativity for such clients as The Valley Hospital, Ramapo College of NJ, Rockland Community College, Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital at Hamilton, Overlook Hospital, Land O’Lake Foods, Eight Oâ€™Clock Coffee, Wurlitzer Jukebox, and Sony Electronics Inc. Ms. Smith was a member of the Bergen County Task Force for Teenage Suicide Prevention. The public awareness campaign that she and Mr. Shaw created for the Suicide Prevention Task Force received special commendations from the Bergen County Board of Chosen Freeholders and received national recognition. She has served on marketing committees for such not-for-profit organizations as Tails of Hope, Children’s Aid and Family Services, American Red Cross, United Way of Bergen County, Elmwood Playhouse and Youth Consultation Services (YCS).
